articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UPDATE 1-Norway's wealth fund posts 1.8 pct return in Q2
articles.description: Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund said it made a return of 1.8 percent in the second quarter, helped by a rise in global equity markets, although it still underperformed the index it is benchmarked against.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: PRESS DIGEST- Canada-Aug 21
articles.description: The following are the top stories from select Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

articles.author: Apeksha Nair
articles.title: PRECIOUS-Gold at 1-week high as Trump remarks on Fed weigh on dollar
articles.description: Gold prices on Tuesday climbed to a one-week high on the back of a weaker dollar, after U.S. President Donald Trump said he was "not thrilled" with the Federal Reserve for raising interest rates.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX gains as oil boost helps energy stocks
articles.description: Canada's main stock index rose on Tuesday as a rally in oil prices pushed energy shares higher.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: METALS-London copper ticks above $6,000 a tonne as dollar slips
articles.description:
Base metals prices rose on
Tuesday, with London copper climbing back above the
$6,000-a-tonne mark, as the dollar slipped, making metals
cheaper for holders of other currencies, while the market
awaited U.S.-China trade talks in Washington.
    Copper prices …

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche
articles.title: UPDATE 2-Norway wealth fund allowed to stay on as investor if Tesla goes private
articles.description: Rules governing Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund would allow it to stay on as an investor in Tesla if the electric carmaker goes private, its deputy CEO said on Tuesday.

articles.title: UK Stocks-Factors to watch on Aug. 21
articles.description:
Britain's FTSE 100 index is seen
opening 16 points lower at 7,575 on Tuesday, according to
financial bookmakers. 
    
    * BHP: Global miner BHP posted a 33 percent jump in
annual underlying profit on Tuesday on robust oil and copper
prices and paid a recor…

articles.author: Claire Milhench
articles.title: EMERGING MARKETS-Emerging stocks rise to 1-week high, lira falls
articles.description: Emerging stocks rose to one-week highs on Tuesday after U.S. President Donald Trump criticised the Federal Reserve for raising interest rates, clobbering the dollar and U.S. Treasury yields, while the lira and rouble continued to fall.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
articles.title: UK can be '21st Century exporting superpower', says Liam Fox
articles.description: The international trade secretary outlines post-Brexit aspirations - but businesses ask for help.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: UK group warns hospitals could run out of drugs post Brexit
articles.description: A group that represents U.K. hospitals has warned that its members may run out of drugs if Britain leaves the European Union without an agreement on future relations

articles.title: US plan for coal power deregulation could cause more deaths
articles.description: Get breaking national and world news, broadcast video coverage, and exclusive interviews. Find the top news online at ABC news.

articles.author: Shannon Connellan
articles.title: We are not worthy of Nicki Minaj's majestic VMAs performance
articles.description: Colossal gold unicorns, gold metallic corsetry, a gold winged throne — Nicki Minaj's VMAs performance was fit for the opulent, epic queen she is. Staging a reportedly pre-recorded, satellite performance away from the awards ceremony venue at New York's Radio …

articles.author: Claire Milhench
articles.title: Sovereign funds pull $5.7 billion from global markets in second quarter
articles.description: Sovereign wealth funds (SWFs) pulled $5.7 billion from stock and bond strategies managed by external asset managers in the second quarter, data from research firm eVestment showed on Tuesday, as trade tensions rocked financial markets.

articles.author: Christopher Woody and Reuters
articles.title: Turkey will reportedly start getting Russia's advanced missile defense system in 2019, despite US efforts to block it
articles.description: Turkey will reportedly start getting the S-400 air-defense system it bought from Russia next year. The purchase has raised tensions between Turkey and its NATO allies, especially the US. Turkey is not the only US partner buying the S-400, which has frustrated…

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: US stocks climb as investors welcome solid company earnings
articles.description: U.S. stocks are moving higher in early trading as investors welcome solid results from homebuilders, retailers and other companies

articles.author: Carmin Chappell
articles.title: Cramer: It’s not too late to buy Walmart
articles.description: Jim Cramer explains why Walmart still has room to run.

articles.author: Darla Mercado
articles.title: Financial advisors and retirement planners want a piece of this tax break
articles.description: You aren't the only one fretting over the 20 percent qualified business income deduction. Your own financial advisor is also stressing over whether his or her practice will qualify.

articles.author: Lucy Handley
articles.title: Koch brothers fund $1.8 million ad campaign for Wisconsin’s Scott Walker ahead of midterm elections
articles.description: Americans for Prosperity Wisconsin (AFP), an arm of the network funded by billionaires Charles and David Koch, is launching an ad campaign in support of Governor Scott Walker ahead of the midterm elections in November. AFP will spend $1.8 million on TV, cable…
